Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2014 08:05PM DeeC wrote: Ladies, I am doing my last Taxol this Thursday and have lost most of my hair.  I am so looking forward to it growing back.  Mine was white before and wonder what color it will come back.  I don't care, I just want it back! Dee
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2014 11:32AM DeeC wrote: I just want hair!  I don't care what color, straight or curly. And while I am at it I want my smell and taste back.  And my stomach to stop hurting and my nose to stop dripping.  And my body to be strong again. Sorry, a venting attack hit me! Dee
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2014 06:53PM DeeC wrote: My hair is starting to grow back mostly on the back and top.  The front and sides are still bald or sparse.  I the long hairs are what is left of my 'old' hair as I didn't shave it, just cut it really short.  It is coming in white which is the color I had before.  Don't see any curls yet.  This is 6 weeks after Taxol. Dee
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2014 09:20PM DeeC wrote: Hello Ladies, I had my first post chemo hair trim today.  Not much to cut but she tidied it up and made it all even.  She put some kind of goo on and tried to make it spike up but it is a little too short.  I am going without my wig more often. As you can see it is very white and no curls yet but some wave.  By the way, I am 1 week shy of 4 months since last Taxol. That's my Dad's pointy nose! Dee
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2014 03:44PM DeeC wrote: Alludp, I just had my hair trimmed.  Mine was a mix of longer wisps of 'old' hair that didn't fall out and short thicker 'new' hair.  It got messy looking.  My hairdresser trimmed it evenly all over and made it look more like a haircut not so much chemo hair.  I did hesitate to cut any off, but it does look better. My youngest son visited me over the weekend and our hair is about the same length! My hair seems to be growing slower than some of you.  Must be the Herceptin. Dee  Dee and Richard
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2014 09:47AM - edited Dec 6, 2014 09:48AM by DeeC Here I am at Thanksgiving, 21 weeks post Taxol. I have had two trims to keep it tidy. I had white hair before. The top is very wavy. I wonder what it will do as it gets longer. On the wig question, I bought a wig and used it when I left the house. I did not think I looked good with my wispy hair. When my hair grew to cover my scalp, no pink showing, I stopped wearing it. I felt self-conscious at first. Now I am enjoying my 'new' hair. This to shall pass...and it did!  Dee
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2014 12:04PM DeeC wrote: LakeGirl1, The woman at my wig shop told me to use Scotch double sided tape to hold my wig.  Trouble is I still have some very fine hair left and don't think the tape would hold.  She didn't have any hair and used it on the back of her neck. Hope this helps. This is what my hair looks like now.  It is thinner than it looks in the picture. Dee
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 22, 2014 11:47AM DeeC wrote: I am on Taxol and Herceptin and based on what I read hear it seems a little kinder to hair.  Mine gradually started thinning after treatment #4.  I am on #7 of 12 Taxol/Herceptin and my hair is very thin but I still have some so looks okay under a scarf or hat.  Still have eyebrows and lashes.  Nothing much underarms and legs but being a blond and having white hair now I never had much anyway. I haven't shaved my head but will if it gets really awful looking.  I understand when I get to the Herceptin alone part of treatment my hair may start to grow back.  Anyone have experience with that? Dee
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2014 02:23PM DeeC wrote: I had very blonde hair growing up and I kept it that way into my sixties.  On day I just got tired of dying it every few weeks and let it come in white.  Everyone told me they loved the color.  I still went back and forth about coloring it again when cancer struck and took it out of my hands.  I will see what I get when it grows back.  I am hoping for curly blonde! Dee
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2014 12:49PM DeeC wrote: I don't even like my husband to see me without a head covering.  At 70 years old my thin hair makes me look 90.  No one has seen me without a hat of some kind   I don't want to appear sick to my family.  I don't think it is vanity, just want to look as much as I can like my old self. My husband is mostly bald and doesn't care about the way my hair looks.  It is just the way I feel. Dee
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2014 09:58AM DeeC wrote: Woo Hoo!   Hubby says it looks like new hair coming in on top of my head!  It is white like my 'old' color. I am 6 weeks since last Taxol. I can't see it myself, sure hope he is right. Dee

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2014 01:43PM DeeC wrote: Me too!  I am afraid to shave of my white fuzz.  Any hair is better than no hair! Dee

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2014 12:39PM DeeC wrote: Marie, The pictures I posted are almost 4 months since last Taxol.  I went to a meeting yesterday where some of the women new me and some didn't.  Only one person said anything to me.  She asked if I cut my hair that short or if it was growing in.  I said it is growing in and I don't plan to leave it that short.  I had to stand up in front of them all and talk and I forgot about my lack of hair. Does anyone know where I can donate my gently used hats and scarves?  I am willing to mail them.  Dee
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2014 09:35AM DeeC wrote: Ladies, Did any of you not shave your head?  My hair thinned slowly and I still have some.  I can wear a baseball cap, other type of small cap or my wig and some hair shows around the edges and bang. Now I am wondering if I should shave my head so the new growth can come in.  Only two more Taxol then on to Herceptin alone and I am told it doesn't cause hair loss.  Will the new hair push out what I have left and grow in? Dee
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2014 06:43PM DeeC wrote: Thanks ladies for your encouragement.  It helps. Dee
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2014 07:22PM DeeC wrote: I was told my hair would thin on Taxol/Herceptin not fall out in clumps.  I already had short hair so I waited to see how it went. It gradually thinned evenly so even when it got sparse I had some strands to show under a cap or scarf for a long time.  I am past my 3 months of Taxol and on to Herceptin alone and my hair continued to fall out so I only have fuzz now. I wear my wig a lot.  It looks better than my real hair did.  Around the house or for casual look I wear a bandana tied behind my head.  $1.50 each at Wall-mart in pink and blue.  I did not look good in any scarf I tried to tie.  I am a small person with a small head and the scarfs and most hats were too big. Now I am waiting for the big comeback!  My 'old' hair was white and straight, I am hoping for curly and blond! Dee
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2014 01:44PM DeeC wrote: Drum roll please........I saw hair on my legs today!  It is fine and white but it was there. I noticed it outside with the sun on my leg.    I am so excited.  I hope my eyebrows and lashes are next. I have white fuzz on my head but think it is still my old hair that was left. Dee
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2014 06:52PM DeeC wrote: Looking good ladies! I went out today without my wig for the first time today.  I thought I was ready, but I noticed some stares and felt self-conscious.  Guess I am not ready yet.  Patience. Dee
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2014 10:00AM DeeC wrote: Yes, to the whole being strong thing.  Sometimes I do feel strong, but mostly one day at a time.  I think the more support you can get from family and friends can help greatly.  I am blessed with a husband who is with me all the way, and he likes to cook! Also, even though I don't feel like it I have found exercise helps both mentally and physically.  I go to a local YMCA for easy water aerobics and take a seated yoga class at the senior center (I am 70).  Other days I walk around the block. One thing I did do that helped make me and others laugh was buy funny cancer tee shirts to wear to treatment.  I have 'Cancer Sucks', Chemo Ninja Cancer Assassins', a 'Winnie the Pooh', and one I made with a sparkly BC cancer ribbon. My sister says "you may not like it, but you have to do it". Dee
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in April 2014 Kazzy115 Sunshine36

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2014 02:51PM DeeC wrote: Ladies, I didn't start my chemo in April but on March 28th so I read this thread.  Am sharing on of my tee shirts.  I have a few to wear to treatment that make me smile. This is how short my hair was before treatment.  Still have some left but very thin. Love your shirt Golfingirl.   Dee
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in April 2014 Kazzy115 Sunshine36

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2014 05:28PM DeeC wrote: A tip from the woman at the wig store.  Use Scotch double sided tape to secure wig.  Sounds weird but she used it herself.  Put it on the back of her neck.  You could also put it on top.  I haven't tried it because I still have some hair left.  But I bought some just in case. Dee
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in April 2014 Kazzy115 Sunshine36

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2014 04:50PM DeeC wrote: SwissMiss, My labs are weekly before each treatment.  If I am not having a problem I see my MO every three weeks. I spent two weeks in the Dark Place.  Just awful.  My MO gave me a week off treatment and I felt so good!  The good does feel better after the bad.  I am back on schedule this week and taking naps every day but no Dark Place.  Only three more Taxol/Herceptin to go.  I can do it! Looks like radiation will start in July along with every three week Herceptin. Me in my wig:
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in April 2014 Kazzy115 Sunshine36
